intro: Tithymalus dracunculoides subsp. intermedius, commonly known as the intermediate tithymalus, is a flowering plant native to parts of Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens.
